definition: at first/suddenly/abruptly/to spread/(of hair) to stand on end/bristling
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

sentences.english: At first glance, Vodafone has nothing to complain about.
sentences.chinese: 乍看之下，沃达丰是没什么可抱怨的了。

sentences.english: ''The Legend of 1900'' is at least gorgeous to look at.
sentences.chinese: 当然《海上钢琴师》至少乍看还是炫目的。

sentences.english: They might look incompatible at a glance, but they’re not.
sentences.chinese: 它们乍看似乎不相容，但其实不然。

sentences.english: A big change in an exchange rate seems at first glance that it should have an immediate impact.
sentences.chinese: 乍看之下，汇率大变似乎该有立竿见影的效果。

sentences.english: If everything seems to be go wrong, you have obviously overlooked something.
sentences.chinese: 若是事事乍看顺遂，那显然是由某个处所没有注重到。

sentences.english: At first glance, the reason is an anti-corruption drive.
sentences.chinese: 乍看之下，出现这个现象的原因是因为反腐败运动。

sentences.english: At first sight, the gold case (pictured) seems an arresting large jewel.
sentences.chinese: 乍看之下，图中的金盒像一件醒目的珠宝。

sentences.english: You might think it is as an ordinary and old-fashioned tabletop at first glance.
sentences.chinese: 您可能认为这是作为一名普通和老式的桌上乍看之下。

sentences.english: For the Chinese, the United States looks increasingly like a banana republic by comparison.
sentences.chinese: 对天朝子民，美帝乍看之下，愈来愈想一香蕉共和国。

definition: seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
to contrast/to set off one another/to go well with
to be evident at a glance (idiom)
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
to blend into one another/to blend together well
(of sb or sth) whole or entire body
